Sign Language: If all phones stopped working, we could communicate long distance using sign language. Sign language is a universal language that can be used to convey emotions, thoughts, and ideas without the use of words. We could create a sign language dictionary or use an existing one to communicate with each other.

Morse Code: Morse code is a system of representing letters and numbers using dots and dashes. We could learn Morse code and use it to communicate long distance by sending and receiving messages through morse code.

Carrier Pigeons: We could train carrier pigeons to deliver messages to different locations. This method of communication has been used in ancient times and could be a viable option in a world without phones.
Smoke Signals: We could use smoke signals to communicate long distance. Smoke signals are a form of non-verbal communication that can be used to convey messages over long distances.
Drumming: Drumming is a form of communication that has been used by many cultures throughout history. We could use drums to communicate long distance by sending messages through rhythm and melody.
